title: Understanding the Problem
text: We are dealing with an ideal gas that is undergoing a reversible isothermal process at constant pressure. We need to calculate the work done on the gas as it is cooled and its volume changes.

title: Work Formula for Ideal Gases
text: For reversible processes at constant pressure, the work done on a gas can be calculated using the formula: w=-P_{ext}(V_f-V_i), where P_{ext} is the external pressure, $$V_f$$ is the final volume, and $$V_i$$ is the initial volume.

title: Plugging in the Values
text: Given: P_{ext}=2 atm, $$V_f=50$$ L, $$V_i$$ $$=100$$ L. First, remember to convert the pressure to the appropriate units if needed. Then, calculate the change in volume and use the formula to find work.

title: Convert Pressure to SI Units
text: Convert the pressure from atm to pascals (Pa).\n$$1$$ atm $$=$$ $$101325$$ Pa.

title: Calculate the Change in Volume
text: What is the change in volume (in L)? Calculate $$V_f-V_i$$ using the given values.

title: Calculate Work Using the Formula
text: Substitute the converted pressure in pascals and the change in volume in the formula to find the work done. Remember, the result will be in joules.
